reviews.review_msg: Lectures were dry and unorganized. Easy concepts were made difficult due to overly complex explanations, and some of the terns used seemed specific to the course as it was impossible to find other definitions. TA marked very hard and did not provide any feedback. There was a very low class average. Would not take another class with him.
This is more like a PHD/Master level course, plus Jim is not a good lecturer

The best class was when he was sick and a TA covered for him. This prof cannot explain anything. But he marks harshly! For assignments, if you make it perfectly you get 8/10, and you only get 10/10 if you make it more than is required. How can students guess what he wants??? His midterm was too long for the time, also.
Do not take this course with him.  Grad students in the combined class but graded the same as undergrads.

Delgrande is a solid prof with a very dry sense of humor. I found myself laughing several times in his classes. Overall I enjoyed his lectures though they could be a bit boring at times. The assignments and midterm/final were fair and not too difficult.
First class I failed in 4 years at SFU. This is probably my fault, although I did attend every lecture. Got an A- in the other class I was taking that semester so...
